ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.2_0: King Pasenadi of Kosala was marching out with the army,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.3_0: and the monks from the group of six went to see the army in action.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.4_0: King Pasenadi saw those monks coming,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.5_0: and he summoned them and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.7_0: “We wish to see the great king.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.8_0: “What have I seen, reverend Sir, with sloth?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.10_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.11_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics go to see an army in action?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.12_0: It’s our misfortune that we must go out with the army for the sake of our livelihood and because of our wives and children.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.13_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.14_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.15_0: “How can the monks from the group of six go to see an army in action?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.16_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.19_0: “... Foolish men, how can you go to see an army in action?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.20_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.21_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.22.1_0: ‘If a monk goes to see an army in action, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:1.23_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.1_0: Soon afterwards a certain monk had a sick uncle in the army.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.6_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against going to see an army in action, that monk thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.7_0: May the sick man not be sick!
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.10_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.11_0: “Monks, I allow you to go to the army when there’s a suitable reason.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.12_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:2.13.1_0: ‘If a monk goes to see an army in action, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.6_0: it has left the inhabited area and is either encamped or marching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.9_0: Each elephant has twelve men; each horse has three men; each chariot has four men; each unit of infantry has four men with arrows in hand.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.10_0: If she is on her way to see it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.11_0: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.12_0: Every time he moves outside of the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.13_0: Except if there is a suitable reason:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.1.14_0: unless there is an suitable reason.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.1_0: If it is in action, and he perceives it as such, and he goes to see it, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.2_0: If it is in action, but he is unsure of it, and he goes to see it, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.3_0: If it is in action, and he perceives it as such, and he goes to see it, except if there is a suitable reason, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.4_0: If he is on his way to see one division of a fourfold army, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.5_0: Wherever he stands to see it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.6_0: Every time he moves outside of the range of sight and then sees it again, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.7_0: If it is not in action, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.8_0: If it is not in action, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.2.9_0: If it is not in action, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.2_0: if he sees it while standing in the monastery;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.3_0: if the army comes to where the monk is standing, sitting, or lying down;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.4_0: if he sees it while walking in the opposite direction;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.5_0: if he has a suitable reason;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc48:3.3.9_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on armies, is finished.
